content: chunky brimmed winter hat/chapeau chunky brimmed winter chapeau i wrote up the pattern but i want to say this up front i like my hat where it has it s own shape and pops on my head-i have thick hair and don t like it squeezing my head if you prefer a snugger hat stop increasing after round 6 and do even row from row 7-22 yarn used wool ease thick n quick-102 yards 6 ounce skein-1 skein you may use two strands of worsted weight yarn held together throughout or a bulky wool yarn hook size 9 mm this was an m hook for me check mm size each manufacturer is different notions needed stitch marker or safety pin tapestry needle for weaving in ends gauge 8 single_crochet = 4 finished size almost 24 in circumference instructions foundation row chain 4 join w/ slip_stitch to form a ring work 6 single_crochet into ring place marker in last single_crochet you will move the marker up for each round-this is worked in a spiral and until round 8 or 7 for the smaller hat you will have an increase made in the marked stitch for each round doing the hat using this method will ensure no seam round 1 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 single_crochet round 2 *1 single_crochet in next st 2 single_crochet in next increase made * repeat around 18 single_crochet round 3 *1 single_crochet in next 2 sts 2 single_crochet in next increase * around 24 single_crochet round 4 *1 single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 single_crochet in next increase *around 30 single_crochet round 5 *1 single_crochet in next 4 sts 2 single_crochet in next increase * around 36 single_crochet round 6 *1 single_crochet in next 5 sts 2 single_crochet in next increase * around 42 single_crochet round 7 *1 single_crochet in next 6 sts 2 single_crochet in next increase * around 48 single_crochet at this round the hat should measure 7 across when laid flat rounds 8-23 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around even no increasing fold up brim and go this pattern and all its contents are ©copyrighted january 2007
